intro: Acer wilsonii var. chekiangense, commonly known as the Chekiang maple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The plant belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
